title: [K-12] Problem-Based Computing Project Design for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and mathematical competency
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course for pre-service teachers emphasizing the ability to use computing tools integrated with mathematics curriculum

learning_goals: Developing Python-based algorithm design skills for solving real-life problems
Enhancing collaborative code analysis and feedback provision capabilities

Learners develop one mathematics education computing project (e.g., a graph calculator using Python) within a week and apply an evaluation system achieving over 70 points (out of 100) on a teacher-provided rubric (functionality 30%, educational effectiveness 40%, creativity 30%).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
